column4: I just installed nVidia GeForce 5500 AGP.  I'm a real newbie.  Found instruction on how to load nvidia.  But how can I check if I have the right drivers for the 5500 installed?
call me Fez:  I want to make sure I installed correctly before I play with Beryl
Are all Ubuntu nvidia drivers one and the same?
no, there are three of them. Restricted Drivers Manager should automatically detect what you need.
So if my new graphics card is working and Restricted Driver Manager appears in my System>Administration menu, I installed it correctly
whether it appears has nothing to do with it
Well, I have a monitor working off the new card.  The Restricted DM say nvidia accelerated installed, so again, how do I know if I installed the right driver?
try running a 3d program like a screensaver and see if that works
Yea, screensavers work (but they worked with my on-board graphics card too, so does that prove anything?)
just trying to learn
I'm not sure then...
you should wait a few minutes (5-10)
Thanks.  Will do.  I just want to make sure I have right nvidia driver installed before I install Beyrl
System>Preferences>Desktop Effects
done.  how do I test it (see app in cube?)
switch desktops or ctrl-alt-drag
no cube  :(
no, it's just that fewer people are in there
it's not really that oftopic, and that's a bug, not a feature.
there's a way to fix that bug, but I'm not sure how... people in ubuntu-effects will know, if they're there.
also try #beryl
no, there is a way to fix it!
just go to #ubuntu-effects and ask, and hopefully they'll tell you.
use sudo -i
